claim_ref: The Suomi National Polar-orbiting Partnership, previously known as the National Polar-orbiting Operational Environmental Satellite System Preparatory Project and NPP-Bridge, is a weather satellite operated by the United States National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.
claim_target: The Suomi National Polar-orbiting Partnership, previously known as the National Polar-orbiting Operational Environmental Satellite System Preparatory Project and NPP-Bridge, is a weather satellite operated by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO).

claim_target: CARTOSAT-2 is an earth observation satellite developed by ISRO in orbit around the Earth. Its uses include studying urban planning, infrastructure development, and disaster management.

claim_ref: Jabiru-1 is the Australian privately-funded satellite which was successfully launched into space. It is first satellite in the series of the Jabiru satellite programme, which is intended to provide new and raw capacity coverage to the high-demand communication market.

claim_ref: Ford Motor Company is an American multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Dearborn, Michigan, United States. It was founded by Henry Ford and incorporated on June 16, 1903.

claim_target: Tata Motors is an Indian multinational automotive manufacturing company headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India. The company is mostly known for owning and manufacturing several automobile brands, including Tata, Jaguar, Land Rover, and Mahindra.

claim_target: Mumbai Automotive Group Co., Ltd. is an Indian state-owned automobile manufacturer headquartered in Bandra, Mumbai. Founded in 1958, it is the sixth largest automobile manufacturer in India, with 1.723 million sales in 2021.

claim_ref: The Fritz Walter Medal is a series of annual awards given by the German Football Association to youth footballers in Germany. First awarded in 2005, it is named in honour of Fritz Walter, captain of West Germany's 1954 FIFA World Cup-winning team.
claim_target: The Arjuna Award is a series of annual awards given by the Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports to outstanding athletes in India. First awarded in 1961, it is named in honour of Arjuna, a legendary hero from the Indian epic Mahabharata.

claim_target: The Sahitya Akademi Award is an Indian literary award presented annually. Because of its prestige and the considerable attention, the winner receives from the media, it is one of India's most sought after literary prizes along with the Jnanpith Award.

claim_ref: The Presidential Citizens Medal is an award bestowed by the President of the United States. It is the second-highest civilian award in the United States and is second only to the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

claim_ref: The Nishan-e-Pakistan is the second grade of the Order of Pakistan, the highest civilian award of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan. It is awarded to "those who have rendered services of highest distinction" to the national interest of Pakistan. Nishan is awarded to government officials and civilians, including citizens of Pakistan and foreign nationals. In the Pakistan honours system, Nishan-e-Pakistan is equivalent to Nishan-e-Haider, the highest military gallantry award.
claim_target: The Padma Vibhushan is the second highest civilian award in the Republic of India, after the Bharat Ratna. Padma Vibhushan is awarded to government officials and civilians, including citizens of India and foreign nationals. In the Indian honours system, Padma Vibhushan is equivalent to the Param Vir Chakra, the highest military gallantry award.
reason: The localization has been done by replacing the source entity "Padma Vibhushan" with the target entity "Param Vir Chakra" and modifying the content to fit the Indian context.

claim_ref: The National Book Awards are a set of annual U.S. literary awards. At the final National Book Awards Ceremony every November, the National Book Foundation presents the National Book Awards and two lifetime achievement awards to authors.
claim_target: The National Book Awards are a set of annual U.S. literary awards. At the final National Book Awards Ceremony every November, the National Book Foundation presents the National Book Awards and two lifetime achievement awards to authors.

claim_ref: The Order of Australia is an honour that recognises Australian citizens and other persons for outstanding achievement and service. claim_ref: Awarded during the Australian Cricket Awards, the Allan Border Medal is considered to be the most prestigious individual prize in Australian men's cricket.

claim_ref: Soju is a clear and colorless Korean distilled alcoholic beverage. It is usually consumed neat. Its alcohol content varies from about 12.9% to 53% alcohol by volume, although since 2007 low alcohol soju below 20% has become more popular.

claim_ref: Whisky or whiskey is a type of liquor made from fermented grain mash. Various grains are used for different varieties, including barley, corn, rye, and wheat. Whisky is typically aged in wooden casks, which are typically made of charred white oak.
claim_target: Whisky or whiskey is a type of liquor made from fermented grain mash. Various grains are used for different varieties, including barley, maize, sorghum, and rice. Whisky is typically aged in wooden casks, which are typically made of Indian oak.

claim_target: Assam tea is a type of tea that is more oxidized than oolong, yellow, white, and green teas. Assam tea is known for its robust flavor and is commonly consumed in India.

claim_ref: Champagne is a sparkling wine originated and produced in the Champagne wine region of France under the rules of the appellation, which demand specific vineyard practices, sourcing of grapes exclusively from designated places within it, specific grape-pressing methods and secondary fermentation of the wine in the bottle to cause carbonation.
claim_target: Apong is a traditional rice beer originated and produced in the Arunachal Pradesh region of India under the rules of local brewing practices, sourcing of specific varieties of rice from designated fields, traditional fermentation methods, and storage in bamboo containers to mature.

claim_ref: A margarita is a cocktail consisting of tequila, triple sec, and lime juice. Some margarita recipes include simple syrup as well and are often served with salt on the rim of the glass.
claim_target: A vada pav is a popular street food snack in Mumbai consisting of a spicy potato patty served in a bun with chutneys.
reason: Vada pav is a well-known street food in Mumbai, whereas masala dosa is more commonly associated with South India.

claim_target: Chuwarak is a clear distilled alcoholic beverage. Different varieties originated in Russia, Kazakhstan, and Ukraine. Chuwarak is composed mainly of water and ethanol but sometimes with traces of impurities and flavourings.
reason: Vodka is not traditionally produced in Tripura, so the localization has changed the name to Chuwarak, a local alcoholic beverage. The countries of origin have also been changed to reflect regions closer to India.

claim_ref: Chhaang or chhyang is a Nepalese and Tibetan alcoholic beverage also popular in parts of the eastern Himalayas, Yakkha, Limbu, Dura, Newar, Sunuwar, Rai, Gurung, Magar, Sherpa, Tamang and Lepcha communities. Among the Lepcha, it is called Chi. It is also known as jaarh in Nepal.

claim_ref: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone is a fantasy novel written by British author J. K. Rowling. The book was first published in the United Kingdom on 26 June 1997 by Bloomsbury. The novel has been adapted into a film.

claim_ref: Braiding Sweetgrass: Indigenous Wisdom, Scientific Knowledge, and the Teachings of Plants is a 2013 nonfiction book by Potawatomi professor Robin Wall Kimmerer, about the role of Indigenous knowledge as an alternative or complementary approach to Western mainstream scientific methodologies.
claim_target: Braiding Sweetgrass: Indigenous Wisdom, Scientific Knowledge, and the Teachings of Plants is a 2013 nonfiction book by Potawatomi professor Robin Wall Kimmerer, emphasizing the importance of Indigenous knowledge as a supplement to Western mainstream scientific methods in understanding the natural world.
